attention1.ptxt: Before starting the following procedure, be sure to observe Precautions on Fuel System Service in order to reduce the risk or fire and personal injury.

s1.ptxt: Install injector to special tool (injector checking tool).
Install pressure regulator to special tool (injector checking tool).
Connect special tools (hose and attachment) to fuel feed pipe (1) of vehicle.
Connect special tool (test lead) to injector.
Install suitable vinyl tube onto injector nozzle to prevent fuel from splashing out when injecting.
Operate fuel pump and apply fuel pressure to injector as follows:

s3.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch OFF.
Turn ignition switch ON, clear DTC and select “MISC TEST” mode on scan tool.
Turn fuel pump ON by using scan tool.
Remove fuel pump relay from connector.
Connect two terminals of relay connector using service wire (1) as shown in the figure.

attention2.ptxt: Check to make sure that connection is made between correct terminals. Wrong connection can cause damage to ECM, wire harness, etc.

s1.ptxt: Apply battery voltage to injector (1) for 15 seconds and measure injected fuel volume with graduated cylinder. Test each injector two or three times.

spec.title: Reference injected fuel volume
spec.ptxt: (For M16 engine model) Approx. 46 cc / 15 sec. (1.62/1.55 US/Imp oz / 15 sec.)
(For J20 engine model) Approx. 65 cc / 15 sec. (2.20/2.29 US/Imp oz / 15 sec.)

s1.ptxt: Check fuel leakage from injector nozzle. Do not operate injector for this check (but fuel pump should be at work). If fuel leaks (1) more than the following specifications, replace.
